ratings.comment: I suggest that he stops teaching. He just copies and pastes the textbook into his lectures. When he walks from one side of the stage to the other, he stops and heaves into the microphone. It's awkward to hear him breathing that heavily into the microphone. I only passed this class because my TA was great.

Lectures were awful, I couldn't read his handwriting & not recorded. My TA (Weng-Him Cheung) was the ONLY reason I passed this class and he is the best TA I've ever had. The class is extremely hard, I attended the math center group tutoring twice a week. Get help outside of class to pass, I didn't think I would. Never learned from Lempp directly.

He wasn't a great lecturer. His accent made class challenging to understand and his handwriting was often obscure. I stopped showing up to lectures when I realized learning calc from youtube was MUCH easier and helped me infinitely more than Steffen did. But don't expect much from Madison's math department.

After taking this class, Lempp is a good 400-500 level professor, but for general calc it was difficult because of the teaching style. I had a great TA and worked my butt off to do well in this class. It is tough but doable. If you have the option, take it with someone else.

Avoid Steffen Lempp at all costs if possible. This guy was an absolute maniac. He called out students for not wearing their masks even if it was just slightly below their nose. I had to work crazy hard to get the A. If I didn't come in with prior calc experience, I would've been toast. I genuinely feel so sad for those coming into this class w/o it
Worst instructor I've ever seen. He thought he did a good lecturing job despite the fact that his average rate is 2.0.

I've never had a professor that has less energy than Lempp. Lectures are almost word for word from the textbook, lectures also consist of him reading from a piece of paper and writing on 8 different chalkboards for 50 mins. This dude is the stereotypical "worst professor ever" and I honestly lost brain cells from this class.

Steffen is perhaps the most boring, bone-dry teacher I have ever encountered. His lectures consisted of writing on a blackboard and expecting students to learn while he breathed heavily into his microphone. Only ever learned from my TA and Youtube. I didn't have a choice to avoid his class, but if you do never step foot in his lecture hall.
If you want to teach your self the entire class, I would definetly reccomend him. if not, do not take this class

This class is not fun but is manageable. My best advice it to read the textbook because you will not learn much from the lectures. Also GO TO CALC LAB! Calc lab was my home for this semester and helped me score high on the exams.

I got stuck with him this semester because he was the only option for 211. He just is not a good professor. He gets off track easily, terrible handwriting, and the MOUTH BREATHING through the microphone drove me crazy. I learned more through the textbook compared to lecture. If you take this class with Lempp just be ready to teach yourself.

This class is hard. The professor isn't really good at explaining topics so I ended up referring to the textbook more. He's a pretty nice guy but just not really good at teaching. He talks fast and you get lost in what he's saying.

Doesnt explain well, impossible handwriting, misses long stretches of class for conferences, not good at explaining and offers little to no prep resources for exams. No old exams, no practice quizzes beyond weekly quizzes.

Lempp is "nice" in terms of his soft-spoken demeanor, but certainly not in his principle. His piazza responses are comedically short and unhelpful. I have a hard time believing he's unaware of that. He refuses to make quiz problems easier, or give us more than five minutes to do them, even after TAs have relayed student feedback multiple times.

Super strict grading criteria on exams that are worth a huge portion of your grade. Significant points are taken off for not doing things that were not even asked for in the question. His lectures are just rambling example questions that are treated as if it was simply review for students who have been taking calculus all their lives. Bad teaching.
Steffen Lempp does not explain the things he states on the chalkboard. No stops in the lecture for questions, continuous lecturing for 50 minutes.
Lemp is a good guy but the lectures are just a ramble. He doesn't explain topics well. Having a good TA is crucial to your success in the class.

This class was really difficult. Steffen Lempp was a nice and understanding guy. There was a major curve that helped me substantially. If you need to take calculus, take it with him. He is way better than the other options.

He is the worst professor. He honestly dont care about your learning at all. He also dont make it any easier for you to get good grades in his class. Instead he will make it 10x harder. Sometimes he will take off points even when you have answered correctly and when you ask for those points back, he will act as if you are asking for his kidney.
Really tough weekly exams that have no similarities to the homework. He was really friendly but not a fan of lecture style. He would just run through things like we already knew them.
Prof. Lempp was a friendly person, but not a good teacher. My class never did well, and thus had to have a 20% curve. Take any other Calculus teacher before him.

It's very difficult if you haven taken Calculus before. Doesn't do a very good job explaining concepts and isn't very good at adjusting online. Best way to learn is the read the textbook because that is what the test is mainly based on.

Took Lempp last semester. Ended up teaching myself the majority of the course material. Going to the discussions are incredibly important, but the lectures were straight from the book so no need to watch them. Quizzes were god awful, crazy complicated application problems compared to the work. Be ready to work as hard as ever.

Professor overall knows what he is talking about. His Handwriting is brutal. This class is very quiz heavy with one every week. One final at the end of the year. The test and quizzes use honorlock and are timed. We had problems all semester with quizzes being to long for the time allowed and multiple problems with honorlock. Hopefully fixed now.

Lempp was the worst professor I have ever had. Tests are way harder than handouts, lectures taken straight from the book, listening to him try to explain anything just made me more confused. Gave no mercy with anything even though we're in a pandemic. I could not tell you not to take his class enough. ABSOLUTELY AWFUL. STAY FAR AWAY FROM LEMPP.

This is literally the worst teacher I have ever had. He teaches from the textbook and does not help you learn at all. He can be very hard to understand sometimes and his handwriting is absolutely awful. When you ask him to explain he says something to the effect of "you do it because you have to." DO NOT TAKE WITH THIS PROFESSOR. Absolutely awful.

Most of Professor Lempp's lectures were right from the textbook. He did not make much of an effort to accommodate students who were struggling a lot with the virtual setting. The only reason this class was not difficult for me was because I had taken a lot of calculus in high school so I can see ppl with no calc background having a tough time.

Professor Lempp is a really nice guy, but the class is extremely hard. It was online this semester and I basically had to teach myself everything. The weekly quizzes which are 80% of your grade are very hard and don't really follow the homework or discussion worksheets. We also had to use honorlock for the quizzes which is a pain in of itself.
Terrible professor. Not understanding at all and unwilling to work with students. Difficult to understand and does not explain well.
The HW and TA handouts are exactly like the exams which makes it easy to study. However, sometimes credit isn't given for free-response questions which causes exam scores to go down by a lot.
Good class a little tricky but nothing to bad and the professor is okay.

pros: very knowledgeable, good at answering questions. exam is far easier than hw, so doing it all will over-prepare you cons: handwriting is TERRIBLE, you will have to stop him in lecture to ask what he wrote. covers a lot of material as 541 is a prep for 542. this means hw assigned during test weeks, and no review sessions before exams
Tests are not fair, puts no effort towards helping students succeed.  Copies lectures straight from the book. Asks very specific questions on tests and take no mercy when grading.
He goes through the material too fast, his handwriting is illegible, and he is bad at explaining one step to the next. Also his method of grading is ridiculously unfair. Don't take this class.

Yes the course was hard. But I would say his handwriting is 100 times harder to decipher!!!!! Never never take his class, unless you feel comfortable and confident about reading the textbook all by your own. Well, actually the textbook is much more helpful than his lectures.

If you care about your GPA even a little bit. DON'T TAKE HIS CLASS!!!!  So far the toughest grader ever encountered. You get the whole problem wrong (20 points out of 100) for merely a calculation error.

His handwriting is aweful and he writes in cursive at that, making his writing extra-terrible. No quizzes, study guides or review sessions in any degree, and only a few questions of your hw is graded, so you have next to no feedback if you're doing anything right. Office hours are like pulling teeth. Just a general lack of care for students.

Common professor from UW Madison. Reads directly from the book, often needs to be corrected. Eastern European accent with a habit of talking too fast and into the board. Tests aren't difficult, but are unfair regarding a lack opportunities to both show what you know and partial credit. I'd say avoid, but look at my premise.

Does not use powerpoint. Most of the time he is just copying from the textbook. Not enough time to ask questions. Does not slow down. Writes very fast and sometimes barely readable. More theoretical and focuses mre on proofs and propositions and less on practical applications in computer science.

Really nice guy who wants to see students do well. Exams make you think but are fair. It is pretty obvious when you don't know the material in this course so don't expect much partial credit on anything. I would take a course with him again

Steffen was generally a good professor. I could tell he wanted us to succeed. 571 is a difficult class. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone outside of math and computer science. His lectures were not useful, he copied things verbatim from the book. Overall, good professor but lectures were not too helpful.

I think he is very helpful, and he explains things clearly. I've always wanted to see logical connections from step to step, and he satisfied me for that. I didn't read the textbook, but I think doing homework was very useful to prepare myself for the exams. Discussion sessions were very helpful in familiarizing with the materials.

hard to follow in lectures. had to be corrected multiple times by students and ta's. nothing interesting about him and doesn't make class interesting. makes us do ridiculous amount of homework and only grades 4 or 5 problems. can't work with others on homework and can't ask ta's questions about homework. worst class ever

Worst managed class I've ever had.  Homework was 20% of grade, which was assigned every week (including exam weeks) and would take 3-4 hours to complete.  He never told you straight-forward what was on midterm.  When a 70/100 on a midterm is considered an A and the average was 41/100, it proves how hard the tests were.

Lempp is really hard to follow in lecture, he often makes mistakes.  Homework is graded and you are not allowed to work in partners, but that is avoidable if you are intelligent about the matter.  His tests are ridiculous, but the curves help a lot. He grades exams very quickly which is nice. Overall a tough professor, but not impossible.

His lectures are almost impossible to follow, he makes tons of mistakes, and assigns homework assignments that are graded so harshly that its almost not worth doing (16 problems a week and 4 are graded, usually the hardest 4) Impossible exams. Friends in 211 with Wainger and almost everyone has 100%!!!! DO NOT TAKE LEMPP !!!!!
The class is hard but if you go to your TA with questions, he/she will help with homeowork by doing similar problems. Professor is very nice.

This guy is terrible. worst professor I have ever seen. His lectures do not even match up with the exams, He assigns tough homework problems and he does not help us with the homework saying he is not allowed to by his standard. He also instructed his TAs to not help us on our hw. What is that? do NOT take a course with him. stay clear from this guy

Tough course.  Sometimes unclear in lecture.  Really didn't do enough examples in class so the homeworks were pretty tough.  The exams were pretty much as described by everyone else.  I went and spoke with him numerous times during his office hours.  He always had a little time to help, but seemed extremely busy and was often distracted.

Whaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa?     Tough teacher.  His somewhat discombobulated classes didn't prepare you at all for the very difficult exams.  You also may feel tempted to dress Prof. Lempp in lederhosen and make him do a merry German dance.      Achtung!

He is absolutely terrible. If you have a choice refrain from taking classes with him. His tests are about 4 really hard questions that nobody knows so it's just graded based on how well you can BS for partial credit. Seriously, you'll regret taking a class with this guy.

His pockets were always full with something.He assigned a lot of howmework, but the tests were far more sophisticated than what the HWs prepared you for.He grows on you personally, but his teaching stinks.Rely on the book,do perfect on the HWs,write as much as you know on exams,get A with his curve.
I learned nothing in his lectures, and neither did anyone else I knew.  Very unclear, poor manner of teaching.  Exams are very hard to perform on, and I did fail 222.
monotonous, makes too many mistakes while lecturing, writes too small, unclear in expectations, nothing good about him really
No Comments
Impossible exams. Mathmatician and elitist. Uncaring and extremely aloof.
